clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Related to Head and Neck Cancer (HNC); Implementation and Evaluation of Self-care Measure Due to the Same Illness
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Related to Head and Neck Cancer (HNC); Implementation and Evaluation of Self-care Measure Due to the Same Illness During Radiotherapy (RT)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of individual education and individual self-care measures on pain intensity, perceived health, mood and sleep during and after treatment with radiotherapy for head and neck cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of individual education and individual self-care measures on pain intensity, perceived health, mood and sleep during and after treatment with radiotherapy for head and neck cancer

study_design_info.masking_description: All patients who referred to the Pain and Rehabilitation Centre at the University Hospital, asked about participation in the study. Of those who agreed to participate every second patient were distributed to the control group versus intervention group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline pain intensity at 20 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity the actual day using a numeric rating scale.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline pain interference at 20 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Pain interference the actual day using a numeric rating scale

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline EQ-5D index at 20 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Perceived health according to the index based on five dimensions of European Quality of Life instrument (EQ-5D index)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline EQ-VAS at 20 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Perceived health according to the visual analgue scale of European Quality of Life instrument (EQ-VAS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline depression at 20 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Depression scale of Hospital and Depression Scale (HADS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline anxiety at 20 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety scale of Hospital and Depression Scale (HADS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline catastrophizing at 20 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Total score of Pain Catastrophizing scale

arm_group.description: Treatment as usual (TAU; i.e. pharmacological treatments and advices) + structured education + instructions on self care
Treatment as usual (TAU; i.e. pharmacological treatments and advices)

intervention.description: Six education areas was offered: pain and pain physiology, pain medication, side effects and prevention of side effects, abuse of medications, sleep advice and advice on anxiety.

The following instructions on self-care for pain relief: apply ice or crushed ice in the oral cavity, lubricating and antiseptic mouth rinses, pain relieving gel, tongue movements and gaps exercises. Prevention of dryness in the mouth and throat; saliva stimulants and saliva substitute agents in different preparations, increased measures of good oral hygiene. Physical activities and regular rest once to several times per day. Sleep restriction and measures to treat sleep disorders.
